title: 479. The Economist’s Guide to Parenting: 10 Years Later
description: In one of the earliest Freakonomics Radio episodes (No. 39!), we asked a bunch of economists with young kids how they approached child-rearing. Now the kids are old enough to talk — and they have a lot to say. We hear about nature vs. nurture, capitalism vs. Marxism, and why you sometimes don’t tell your friends that your father is an economist.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
